result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Michael Duffy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Michael Duffy is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Michael Duffy was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF: Nicholas Michael Duffy appeared from jail.  Court called.  Includes 15CF215 (Motion Hearing) & 17CF361 (ARGN) & 15CT89 (probation review hearing).  Attorneys make statements.  

Crt orders on 15CT89
- Court lifts the stay on the 120 days conditional time commencing July 14, 2017
- Court grants huber for work


Crt orders on 15CF215
- Crt enters in the adjudication of guilt on Ct. 1
- Crt orders the DE to serve 120 days in the St. Croix County Jail concurrent to 15CT89 with credit for good time commencing today 08/18/17
- Court huber for work
- Crt orders any remaining costs of the F/F from the original sentencing apply the money on file 
- 20 days to appeal

There is an agreement and the court proceeds with the plea/sentencing for 17CF361.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 17CF361.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE guilty of Ct 2 in 17CF361. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 17CF361. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 2 in 17CF361
S/W 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- DE to complete any treatment or therapy recommended by the probation agent
- Court orders court costs of $243 and $200 for the DNA surcharge apply money on file and any remaining balance to be paid through probation
- 20 days to appeal
filed by Atty. Smestad. gme
Atty Smestad. hml
to Revoke Deferred Judgment of Conviction. hml

INCLUDES 17CF361 and 15CF215

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. I further understand that I am required to submit to random ALCOHOL/DRUG testing, at least 3 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing pursuant to the Day Report Center protocols. If UA testing is required, the same shall be viewed in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex. Additional testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

**BOND AMENDED**

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Eric C. Thole   DF:  Nicholas Michael Duffy appeared. Includes 15CF215 amd 15CT89 Case called at 1:14 pm. Court reviews file. Atty Thole presents signed DJOC to the court. ADA Minser recites agreement. No Compas has been completed. No objection from Atty Thole. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 15CT89 and 15CF215 , Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one in 15CT89. Court witholds entering conviction on 15CF215 in favor of Diversion agreement. Agreement will be in effect for 2 years. Bond remains in effect. Court dismisses Count #2 and #3 in 15CT89. Court also dismisses Counts #2 and #3 in 15CF215. Parties make sentencing arguments. In 15CT89 Court orders: 2 years probation w/h with conditions:
- 180 Days Jail.120 Days STAYED. Huber for employment and treatment. Credit for 7 days
- F/F $1694.00
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA within 60 Days
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Def to appear in court on 4/6/2016 at 4:30 pm
- 24 month rev with credit for adminstrative suspension and 24 month IID
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 1/8/2016
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Defendant taken into custody of St. Croix County Sheriff. km
